frontMatter.title: Business Model Design
frontMatter.metaDescription: A Business Model is a visualization of how a company plans to operate, create value and make money. The Business Model Canvas consists of nine cells that capture different aspects of a business. It can be used to describe different companies from a startup to a large enterprise.

checklist.question: MJ_Test_Demo-Do you have your business model documented in the form of a canvas (or an equivalent)?
checklist.expectation: MJ_Test_Demo-Visualize the business model of your product to analyze and optimize how the front-stage (customer-facing elements) and back-stage (partners, key activities, key resources and cost) operate in synergy.

checklist.question: Do you define your product features under Value Proposition?
checklist.expectation: You shouldn't actually mention product features here, rather, think about benefits your product will offer your customers.

checklist.question: If you do the activities listed in 'Customer Relationships', will you be able to find and enough retain customers to build a sustainable business?
checklist.expectation: Customers are key in any business. Your plan here has to be well thought through.

checklist.question: If you do the activities listed on the left, will you be able to deliver all customer facing (right side) activities effectively?
checklist.expectation: Analyze and find out how coherent the different segments are in your business model.
